title: Notary signing for disabled person
context: [ยง456-19] Notary signing for disabled person. A notary may sign the name of a person physically unable to sign or to make a mark on a document presented for notarization; provided that the notary is satisfied that the person has voluntarily given consent for the notary to sign on the person&rsquo;s behalf, if the notary writes, in the presence of the person: &ldquo;Signature affixed by notary pursuant to section 456-19, Hawaii Revised Statutes.&rdquo; beneath the signature, and if a doctor&rsquo;s written certificate is provided to the notary certifying that the person is unable to physically sign or make a mark because of the disability, and that the person is capable of communicating the person&rsquo;s intentions. [L 1995, c 141, ยง1]
